verses.text: Now when Jacob saw that there was corn in Egypt , Jacob said unto his sons , Why do ye look one upon another?
And he said , Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt : get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live , and not die. \p
¶ And Joseph’s ten brethren went down to buy corn in Egypt.
But Benjamin , Joseph’s brother , Jacob sent not with his brethren ; for he said , Lest peradventure mischief befall him.
And the sons of Israel came to buy \add corn\add* among those that came : for the famine was in the land of Canaan.

And Joseph \add was\add* the governor over the land , \add and\add* he \add it was\add* that sold to all the people of the land : and Joseph’s brethren came , and bowed down themselves before him \add with\add* their faces to the earth. \p

And Joseph saw his brethren , and he knew them, but made himself strange unto them, and spake roughly unto them; and he said unto them, Whence come ye? And they said , From the land of Canaan to buy food.\f + \fr 42.7 \ft roughly…: Heb. hard things with them\f*
And Joseph knew his brethren , but they knew not him.
And Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed of them, and said unto them, Ye \add are\add* spies ; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
And they said unto him, Nay, my lord , but to buy food are thy servants come.
We \add are\add* all one man’s sons ; we \add are\add* true \add men\add*, thy servants are no spies.
And he said unto them, Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.
And they said , Thy servants \add are\add* twelve brethren , the sons of one man in the land of Canaan ; and, behold, the youngest \add is\add* this day with our father , and one \add is\add* not.
And Joseph said unto them, That \add is it\add* that I spake unto you, saying , Ye \add are\add* spies :
Hereby ye shall be proved : By the life of Pharaoh ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest brother come hither.

Send one of you, and let him fetch your brother , and ye shall be kept in prison , that your words may be proved , whether \add there be any\add* truth in you: or else by the life of Pharaoh surely ye \add are\add* spies.\f + \fr 42.16 \ft kept…: Heb. bound\f*
And he put them all together into ward three days.\f + \fr 42.17 \ft put: Heb. gathered\f*
And Joseph said unto them the third day , This do , and live ; \add for\add* I fear God :
If ye \add be\add* true \add men\add*, let one of your brethren be bound in the house of your prison : go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses :
But bring your youngest brother unto me; so shall your words be verified , and ye shall not die. And they did so. \p

¶ And they said one to another , We \add are\add* verily guilty concerning our brother , in that we saw the anguish of his soul , when he besought us, and we would not hear ; therefore is this distress come upon us.
And Reuben answered them, saying , Spake I not unto you, saying , Do not sin against the child ; and ye would not hear ? therefore, behold, also his blood is required.
And they knew not that Joseph understood \add them;\add* for he spake unto them by an interpreter.\f + \fr 42.23 \ft he spake…: Heb. an interpreter was between them\f*
And he turned himself about from them, and wept ; and returned to them again , and communed with them, and took from them Simeon , and bound him before their eyes. \p
¶ Then Joseph commanded to fill their sacks with corn , and to restore every man’s money into his sack , and to give them provision for the way : and thus did he unto them.
And they laded their asses with the corn , and departed thence.
And as one of them opened his sack to give his ass provender in the inn , he espied his money ; for, behold, it \add was\add* in his sack’s mouth.

And he said unto his brethren , My money is restored ; and, lo , \add it is\add* even in my sack : and their heart failed \add them\add*, and they were afraid , saying one to another , What \add is\add* this \add that\add* God hath done unto us?\f + \fr 42.28 \ft failed…: Heb. went forth\f* \p
¶ And they came unto Jacob their father unto the land of Canaan , and told him all that befell unto them; saying ,
The man , \add who is\add* the lord of the land , spake roughly to us, and took us for spies of the country.\f + \fr 42.30 \ft roughly…: Heb. with us hard things\f*
And we said unto him, We \add are\add* true \add men;\add* we are no spies :
We \add be\add* twelve brethren , sons of our father ; one \add is\add* not, and the youngest \add is\add* this day with our father in the land of Canaan.

And the man , the lord of the country , said unto us, Hereby shall I know that ye \add are\add* true \add men;\add* leave one of your brethren \add here\add* with me, and take \add food for\add* the famine of your households , and be gone :

And bring your youngest brother unto me: then shall I know that ye \add are\add* no spies , but \add that\add* ye \add are\add* true \add men: so\add* will I deliver you your brother , and ye shall traffick in the land. \p

¶ And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks , that, behold, every man’s bundle of money \add was\add* in his sack : and when \add both\add* they and their father saw the bundles of money , they were afraid.

And Jacob their father said unto them, Me have ye bereaved \add of my children:\add* Joseph \add is\add* not, and Simeon \add is\add* not, and ye will take Benjamin \add away:\add* all these things are against me.
And Reuben spake unto his father , saying , Slay my two sons , if I bring him not to thee: deliver him into my hand , and I will bring him to thee again.

And he said , My son shall not go down with you; for his brother is dead , and he is left alone: if mischief befall him by the way in the which ye go , then shall ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
